text: I am trying to configure a custom julia registry with RegistryCI.jl and I have some questions regarding that. Is this the right place to ask?

elements.text: I am trying to configure a custom julia registry with RegistryCI.jl and I have some questions regarding that. Is this the right place to ask?

text: Sure

elements.text: Sure

text: What is the process of using RegistryCI.jl? I didn't find docs and I just copied the files from the example folder in my workflow folder, but they don't seem to work. <https://github.com/ctp-fpub/JuliaRegistry/actions>

text:
I saw that the ci workflow fails on the following test: <https://github.com/ctp-fpub/JuliaRegistry/runs/2104470366?check_suite_focus=true#step:7:5>

It looks like it checks if something in regards to the UUIDs of the packages, but I'm not sure I understand what

elements.text: I saw that the ci workflow fails on the following test:
It looks like it checks if something in regards to the UUIDs of the packages, but I'm not sure I understand what

text: could it be that one of the dependencies of SDFResultViewer is not registered in your registry or in General? It sounds like it can’t find one of the dependencies

elements.text: could it be that one of the dependencies of SDFResultViewer is not registered in your registry or in General? It sounds like it can’t find one of the dependencies

text: Oh, yeah, it depends on the other package in the registry (PICAnalysisTools)

elements.text: Oh, yeah, it depends on the other package in the registry (PICAnalysisTools)

text: Should I do something like `RegistryCI.test(registry_deps=["${{ github.repository }}"])`?

elements.text: Should I do something like
RegistryCI.test(registry_deps=["${{ github.repository }}"])

text: I think it should be OK if it’s registered in the same registry, it looks like the code grabs those UUIDs too: <https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/RegistryCI.jl/blob/31f70b1c8151f197001ce93557626f2809dd3179/src/registry_testing.jl#L119> (edit: fixed link)

elements.text: I think it should be OK if it’s registered in the same registry, it looks like the code grabs those UUIDs too:
(edit: fixed link)

text: you could `dev` RegistryCI and make it print what the UUID is that is in `depuuids` but not `alluuids` . Probably the test should be rewritten as `@test isempty(setdiff(depuuids, alluuids))` so that you get a better failure message. (PRs appreciated!)

elements.text: you could
dev
RegistryCI and make it print what the UUID is that is in
depuuids
but not
alluuids
. Probably the test should be rewritten as
@test isempty(setdiff(depuuids, alluuids))
so that you get a better failure message. (PRs appreciated!)
